DataElement.preferredName: Breast Palpable Lymph Node Laterality Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The side of the breast where a lymph node is capable of being handled, or touched, or felt.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Capable of being handled or touched or felt._A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection._Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Property.preferredDefinition: Capable of being handled or touched or felt.:A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.:Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.

Concepts.definition: Capable of being handled or touched or felt.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.
Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hemispheric projection, including the mammary gland, located on the anterior portion of the chest, lateral to the midline, on the side of the body to the east when facing north.

Concepts.definition: The hemispheric projection, including the mammary gland, located on the anterior portion of the chest, lateral to the midline, on the side of the body to the east when facing north.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hemispheric projection, including the mammary gland, located on the anterior portion of the chest, lateral to the midline, on the side of the body to the west when facing north.

Concepts.definition: The hemispheric projection, including the mammary gland, located on the anterior portion of the chest, lateral to the midline, on the side of the body to the west when facing north.
